posts.content:
Hello to all guildmembers!

I'm try figure out how damage calculation works in NWN1.  On d6 roll, for example, probability is:
1) 1,2,3,4,5,6 same for all rolls
2) higher chance for 4 and 3, and less chance for 1 and 6?

p.s. according to this article on NWNVault
https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... rmula-dice
it seems 2) variant.

p.s.s. As far as i understand mechanics of game, best 1h weapon will be battleaxe, if I'm encounter enemy with relatively high DC, (for example 70% chance to hit with 1st attack in row), and relatively high DR, compare to scimitar (with equal feats and additional damage of other types on weapon)?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, actually, for any weapon that does a straight amount of damage (no conglomeration) like this (1-6), the chance is equal for 1,2,3,4,5 or 6.

There really is no "higher chance" for a 3 or 4 here.

Where that starts to come into play is 2-8 (2d4), 2-12 (2d6), etc.  Then the chances that the middle numbers come up increases.

So no, the Battleaxe is not the best 1-h weapon in the game.  It also does 1d8, not 1d6.  Maybe you mean the handaxe??

Also, to compare weapons like this, you also need to factor in the crit range and bonus imo.

If what you mean here is Battleaxe vs Scimitar, and you are only talking base damage, then yes, Battleaxe>Scimitar (1d8 > 1d6). 

Otherwise, a Bastard Sword/Katana does 1d10>1d8 of the Battleaxe.

posts.author: yoppil
posts.content:
Thank you, webshaman for light-speed replay!

So no, the Battleaxe is not the best 1-h weapon in the game.  It also does 1d8, not 1d6.  Maybe you mean the handaxe??
I just take d6 damage as example for understanding game mechanics. 
For calculation Battleaxe's damage I'm use spreadsheet form NWNVault (and done some calculations myself), and take into a count these parameters:
1) 1d8 base damage
2) CritMuli x3
3) Crit range 18-20 (increased from Improved critical+keen)
4) STR modifier 1 (for One-handed)
5) Chance to hit manual set to 16 (meaning that i need roll from 16 to 20 to hit)
6) Damage bonus manual set to 10 (just for example to add approx. damage enhancements)
7) Attribute bonus damage manual set to 10 (to calc STR modifier)
8) Damage Reduction of target manual set to 5
than calculating average damage per attack with exception that enemy is not undead . That average damage per attack I'm compare with Scimitar (with same bonuses and feats)

As far as I'm understand, scimitar is superior, than i can easly hit target within its threat range. If target harder to hit, than crit multiplier is more valuable. And if i had 4 attacks per round, and 1-st has around 70% chance to hit target, than 2,3,4 attacks have even less chance to hit target.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello and welcome, @yoppil !

Hope you don't mind, but I've shifted this discussion over to the General Discussion forum - it seemed more appropriate.

And if it's purely a damage calculation you're looking for, then those 2-handers with their 1.5 damage per hit have to be factored in, surely? (And if you want to leave melee weapons behind, the Arcane Archer hoves into view with its ranged +1 damage on every other level taken.)

As with pretty much all things NwN, there are many factors that come into play. What weapons can the PC use? Are enemies susceptible to crits/ sneaks? Will there be lots of undead/ constructs where you play? (Ranger's Bane of Enemies comes to mind as a factor there.) Which classes will you be taking? What race will you be playing? How many hits achieving damage can you anticipate per round/ flurry? (Monk, anyone?) And so it goes on...

But the absolutely critical thing is - how much will you enjoy playing your character?

Maths only takes you so far, after all.

Cheers
